Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure to stay at the Residenza A”
Reviews.Author: sb5000
Reviews.Content: Everything about the Residenza A is terrific. The staff go out of their way to always be helpful. The location is fantastic and the rooms are great. I´ve been coming to the Residenza A for many years and the service and rooms are alway up to a great standard. I generally come to Rome on business and it´s so wonderful to be able to come back and relax in such a wonderful place. I certainly recommend the Residenza A to anyone coming to Rome as the hotel is in a great area of the city surrounded by wonderful restaurants and it´s economically priced.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality at a central location”
Reviews.Author: vsylee
Reviews.Content: Hidden behind unobtrusive doors between a shoe store and a cafe, lies the entrance to this boutique hotel. Rooms are named S, M, L, XL, XXL giving you a sense of the size you'll get with your booking. Ask for rooms facing the back if you want a quieter stay as the rooms at the front overlook Via Vittorio Veneto which is busy all day and through the night. Rooms are a decent size and neutrally decorated in a pleasing cream, white, black theme. I took the breakfast option at next door Cafe Strega, which was a great experience. I could choose from 4 different breakfast packages. Food wasn't blow-away, but it was fresh and a reasonable amount. Service at the hotel reception was professional, courteous and helpful. They quickly changed my room from M to L when I found that I couldn't sleep the first night due to the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: sox33
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in October, the location is good, about a 15 minute walk to the Spanish Steps. A night you definitely have to take a taxi to get to the good night life or restaurants, mostly in campo de fiore (?) and piazza de Navona area. I really liked the size of the hotel, it felt like staying in out own little apartment or condo in Rome. We stayed in the "S" room. I will mention that when I go on vacation I am not expecting to watch tv or be on the Internet much at all. However, the free wifi was a bonus for European hotel standards, although it s kind of spotty. The staff was all wonderful, especially Giordianno who gave us great restaurant recommendations. Breakfast in the room was good for something light and it was nice having coffee there first thing. I would recommend staying here, just keep in mind that it is a boutique hotel and not a big chain.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: steelered42
Reviews.Content: Located on a great street Via Venetto, close to Metro stops and Park. Stylish and very nice, comfortable, would definitely stay here again. We were three with a 13 yr. old daughter, room has big king size and bed for her. Excellent help from the two men working the front desk, good places to eat around especially Hosteria Romana....wonderfull dinner! Couldn't have asked for better, a pleasant surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Formula1Champ
Reviews.Content: This place is more of a residence than a hotel. The hotel lobby is very small but the location is excellent. The rooms are clean and breakfast at the café below the hotel was good (coffee, juice, croissant and omelet). The entrance to the hotel is awkward. On the downside, the tv didn’t work in our room and Imac was ridiculously slow. Also, it be a little noisy sometimes but after sightseeing most people would pass out anyways. Bottom line is that rooms are clean and location is awesome with so so amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Small but nice, but bad breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Nina801
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for an long-weekend in February 2011. The hotel was a bit difficult to find because of the neutral entrance, which looks more like an apartment building than a hotel. The hotel is very small, but with nice and modern rooms. There were some noise from the street, so if you're a light sleeper it could be a problem. There is no restaurant or breakfast room; you fill out a form the day before and get the breakfast delivered to the room. Unfortunately the breakfast apparently has a long travel between the kitchen and the room; the coffee was always cold. If you don't like the cleaning staff to touch your things and move things around- don't leave you stuff around... But other than that, the staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel in a Very Nice Area.”
Reviews.Author: midasttt
Reviews.Content: We had 2 rooms for the 5 of us (2 adults and 3 children). Both of our rooms were at the end of the hall (XXL and XL). The rooms were very nice and clean and it was quiet. We enjoyed breakfast at the cafe next door. I was a little concerned when they gave us the keys to the building because they leave at 10pm for the night, but it was not an issue at all. The Via Veneto area is very nice also and we had a number of fine restaurants to choose from for dinner each night. The walk to attractions was not bad. It was about a 10 minute walk to the Spanish Steps through the underground Metro walkway and 10 minutes to Piazza Barberini. If we were to return to Rome, we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel in a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: shaunandjo
Reviews.Content: We had a really nice stay in this hotel on both occasions we have stayed there. Its very stylishly decorated, was clean and the guys that run the place are great, arranging transfers, and assisting with anything that we needed. Its a nice walk to most of the main tourist attractions and located in a wonderful area along Via Veneto. Its a little noisy at night but you come to expect that from a bustling city like Rome so not a worry for us. I would highly recommend to anyone that is a fussy traveller (like me) who likes to be in nice location without paying the earth! Five stars! And thanks again to all of the guys who looked after us. See you next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly staff who were like our own personal tour guides. A little expensive though.”
Reviews.Author: edintraveller103
Reviews.Content: Fantastic boutique hotel. We looked through lots of chinzy Roman hotels before we chose to book this one. It was a little more expensive but worth it. The room was very modern and clean, the hotel staff couldn't have been more friendly and gave us lots of useful hints and tips. The only downside is that you can hear (not too loudly) people in the other rooms and reception but not loud enough to keep you awake at night. On the whole, I would definitely recommend if you are looking for a nice, modern hotel in a fantastic location and dont want to pay premium prices.

Reviews.Title: “nice place!”
Reviews.Author: zsuzsanna09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Residenza A in April (4 nights ) and we really had a great weekend in Rome. We were very impressed with this hotel! It was a very warm welcome after a very tiring travel. The staff were polite and helpful with good suggestions of restaurants, recommended bus routes and arranged airport transfers. Everything was very clean and modern design: we had the room "ML" with the nice via Veneto view. Breakfast was very good and served in the room or at Caffe’ Strega . The hotel offers free WiFi and internet with free access from pc in each room. We loved Rome and of course this very tidy and very nicely furnished Hotel Absolutely we will stay again at The Residenza A. Zsuzsanna Budapest Hungary

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in Best Neighborhood in Rome great Value”
Reviews.Author: mahopac
Reviews.Content: It doesn't get any better staying on the Via Veneto and paying less than $300 per night! That includes breakfast at an upscale cafe right next door to the hotel. The staff was wonderful and very helpful. The room was stylish, comfortable and clean. We loved the hotel and will certainly stay here again when in Rome.. It was so well situated to all he sites. In addition the hotel arranged for a private transfer for us from the airport for slightly more than a taxi, which was much more comfortable than the hassle of a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Boutique Hotel In The Heart Of Rome, With Awesome Service!”
Reviews.Author: Ernie-Diane
Reviews.Content: The Residenza A Boutique hotel truly stands out as being a top tier Boutique Art Hotel. We enjoyed our first stay in October 2009. During our visit to Rome in September 2010, we wanted to stay once again with Residenza A. As the same as our visit last year, Franesco was very kind and went out his way to make our stay truly grand! The location is great, and close to all the major sites. Via Vento is a beautiful area of the city to make your stay in. We always feel safe and secure at the hotel and area. The rooms are very up scale with all the modern decor. The Apple Computer in the room with free internet is nice to use. Great shower and beds. In the morning we enjoy a great breakfast downstairs at the Cafe Spaga. All this is included with your stay. The staff provides tours, and transportation at your request. Franesco carried our bags to our waiting car, just as he did last year. You will love Residenza A. This is our first choice when staying in Roma. You will the time of your life! Thank You to all the staff for making our stay once again amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: m1cke
Reviews.Content: At first hard to find as it is quite well hidden in what seems to be residents flats. Once found you go up some stairs and you are there in a quaint little hotel of around 10 rooms. Reception knew our names as we walked in and our room was ready. The room was an adequate size for the 2 of us and the Bulgari tolietries and the apple mac were a real nice touch. The room was clean, mini bar full and television working! Breakfast was in a nice little restaraunt a couple of doors down from the hotel and although the place looks nice the food was not great. We had a few days of cold toast and warm cereal! The only problems we experienced were that they lock the front door after a certain time and although you have a key it was difficult to open. In the end I had to ring the bell and the guy that came did not seem too best pleased. The only other problem was that our neighbours liked to shower at about 3 in the morning and you could hear them! And one last note to watch out for is that we used the hotels taxi service for our return journey to the airport which should have been a set price but the driver tried to get an extra 5 euros from us, which I refused to pay. I do not blame the hotel for this but the driver. All in all the hotel is on an OK location and we had a lovely stay with good service and a big smile nothing seemed like too much trouble for the staff and they helped with all our requests.

Reviews.Title: “If you are going to Rome, stay here.”
Reviews.Author: TravelingLaura
Reviews.Content: Loved this place! Now realize that it is not a big hotel, not a 5 star luxury, but for the price and for the level it is EXCELLENT! The room is clean, modern, and reminded me a bit of a New York City pricey hotel. The bathroom is lovely. My room was the less expensive one XS which was actually very quiet and peaceful. The wood floors are very nice. The location is optimal, in a safe, nice neighborhood down the street from Harry's Bar, near the metro station, convenient to the taxi stand, good restaurants, Spanish Steps etc. The staff were VERY nice, helpful, arranged airport pick-up, dinner recommendations and the service was superb. I felt very comfortable and safe here and enjoyed the privacy of having my own key to come and go in the evenings. We had breakfast in the room one morning (very nice) and ate at the restaurant downstairs another day for breakfast. The computer in the room is very handy! I would highly recommend this boutique hotel if you are looking to spend less than 500 Euro a night and still stay at a very charming place.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Art Hotel and staff are lovely!”
Reviews.Author: msmothers
Reviews.Content: Staff was so very accomodating and responded very quickly to our emails prior to arrival. They offered to make us transportation arrangements from the airport and to the port in Civitavecchia and booked us with a FABULOUS tour agency for the Vatican. They were very accomodating in checking us in early from our red eye flight from USA (we were in Room "L") and also stored our luggage for us after check out so we could maximize our time at the Vatican. The street is tree-lined and quite with great restaurants. The Metro is only a short 5 minute walk and the park is practically in your backyard! We had a very early day at the Vatican and breakfast was delivered to our room exactly on time. Free internet was icing on the cake! We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Tguch
Reviews.Content: During the last Jubilee, Rome began to allow residential areas to turn their apartments into "boutique" hotels. The Italians call these places "pensioners" (or something like that), ie. they are not real hotels. This hotel falls into that category. It is a remodelled apartment on the first floor off Via Veneto. It is noisy (you can hear the traffic outside and the receptionist on the phone from your bedroom) and small. It is very nice and friendly and clean etc, and I still enjoy these smaller places to a large chain hotel, but I would not stay at this one again. Plus: Bulgari lotions and soaps in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “a gem”
Reviews.Author: p101
Reviews.Content: Found this by accident when checking reviews of another "Residenza" - some of the review comments are clearly mixed up. Glad we did anyway. This is really well-located: convenient for park, walking into main part of city, short walk to metro, away from the crowds. Just a small number of comfortable, clean rooms. The reception is 'manned' from 7am to 10pm and all of the staff were really friendly & helpful - arranging tickets, transport, and offering recommendations. Cafe Strega, next-door, is excellent for breakfast and evening meals - though there's no shortage of other good restaurants nearby. If you want an early start, you can get breakfast in your room from 7am.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice room - more like an appartment than a hotel”
Reviews.Author: CphTwo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Residenza "A" for three nights in July at the beginning of our vacation to Italy. We have been to Rome before, and chose this hotel primarily because of the location and the design style of the room. And let me say immediately, we were not dissapointed! The hotel is exactly what it shows on the internet. The rooms are very minimalistic but nice. There is only a very small reception area, and after 22.00 it is closed. As a guest you are provided with a key, so you can enter the building. One thing you should notice though is, that the hotel only has 7/8 rooms, and therefore you never get the "hotel feeling" - it is more as a hotel appartment. As a consequence of this, there is no breakfast room, so you enjoy this at the café which is located just down the stairs. We stayed in room XL, but were moved to another room as the aircondition spilled water. Staff were extremele serviceminded, and did their best to accomodate the different requests we had. And the location, in a very upscale area in walking distance to the Spanish steps and right beside Villa Borghese - perfect!!! We will definately recommend this place, but primarily for couples without children.

Reviews.Title: “Small Via Veneto hotel”
Reviews.Author: pkgclub
Reviews.Content: This place is just right. Small seven room hotel, idealy located,110 euros for an ok double, warm, designy, small but very very beautiful bathroom, very clean, big closets, easy address, apple computer, flat screen tv, our room gave to Via Veneto but the double windows and the heavy curtains provided calm and privacy and the staff was very polite and easy going and very helpful. This very small hotel is located on the first floor of an aging but grand apartment/office bldg with doorman and for the after hours we were provided with the keys to the building and the hotel. It is basically a large apartment expertly amended for a tiny hotel. Staff gave us tips on where and how to go and even suggested against calling a cab over hailing one since it will save us couple of euros or five - one block down the street is the Excelsior taxi stand. Good breakfast is in the room from 7 to 830 and at the Stregga coffee shop downstairs after 830. Ideal for couples on time off.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: zcacgje
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our first trip to Rome to celebrate our Anniversary. We'd hunted round for something with a bit of character whilst still providing the Modern conveniences of modern hotels. We were not disappointed. As many others have said, this is more of a guest house than a hotel. There are no porters or room service. It occupies half of the 1st floor of a block of residential apartments. You arrive to an innoculous looking doorway and wonder if you're at the right place. Don't panic though - you just need to press the "Residenza A" buzzer and someone will come down and let you in. As is is a small business, reception closes at 10pm - if you're going to arrive after this time, you'll need to contact them to let them know so they can arrange to be there to let you in! Our flight was delayed meaning we got there at 10:45 - fortunately there was someone there, but he wasn't impressed (until we explained about the delay). The staff at the hotel are very welcoming and will do anthing they can to make your trip enjoyable. Top tip - contact the hotel in advance to arrange a car to collect you at the airport. We flew into Fiumicino airport and had to pay €60 (fixed price) for a cab to get into central Rome (which was terrifying!). On the way back the hotel arranged a car (nice comfy Mercedes) to take us back costing just €45 (again fixed price). We were given room ML which is at the front of the hotel. We had no problem with noise from the road outside, and it was quite nice to watch the world go by on the street below and people coming and going from Cafe Strega. We did notice that there was quite a bit of light still coming into the room from outside during the night, but the next morning discovered that there is a switch outside the window to turn off the flourescent light which illuminates the hotel name etched onto the window. The room was a good size and comfortable and the bathroom modern and clean. The decor was fresh and modern and the individual art that arorned the walls in the room and the corridor gave it a nice individual feel. The Apple Mac computer was very useful for checking email and booking restaurants during our stay. My only critisism is that the internet browser software could do with upgrading as it was struggling with a few of the more modern websites we were accessing. The DVD player in the room was a nice touch, however the rental list at reception was a bit limited. I recommend bringing your own films if you want to use this facility (obviously European region discs only..) As with every other mainland European hotel we've stayed in, the choice of English speaking TV channels is limited to just one (in this case CNN), but it wasn't an issue for us, as we weren't there to watch TV. The breakfast was included and I would say was the only weak point. The toast was toasted on one side only and seemed to be cold every morning. Also being british we like our tea, which lead to all sorts of confusion when we requested milk to go with it. One day I ordered cereal and again - no milk! Also Italian croissants aren't like French style ones, they come covered in icing sugar and often pre-filled with a fruit filling - very odd.. At the end of the day we put it down to the Italians just doing things differently - it wasn't a major issue for us. The hotel is well located for getting around Rome. Barberlini metro station is a 5 minute walk (downhill) and about 7 mins back (uphill). All the major sights are walkable - we tended to walk in the morning and get the metro home in the evening. Worked out really well for us. Overall, we were very happy with our stay and will definitely return when we're next in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean and Cute”
Reviews.Author: kmixal
Reviews.Content: Very good. Location is one of the best in Rome. Clean and elegant rooms. Public transportation is very convenient. Electric bus stops outside the hotel and goes to nearly all the most known places in the city. It is recommended, If you want a nice, clean and convenient place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal and a neat, quirky stay”
Reviews.Author: dagnyt
Reviews.Content: I looked and looked and couldn't find any decently prices accommodations in Rome that fit into my budget. I'd splurged in Florence so I need to keep this just a bit cheaper. Found Residenza A through the hotels-by.com site and then through its own site. It seems like someone with half a floor decided to turn it into a little hotel. With just 7 rooms, there's not a lot of personal service, but what is there is pretty nice. The breakfast comes up form Cafe Strega downstairs if you order it in time, or you can go down and eat outside. Either one is great. Each room has an iMac, so you can look stuff up and while the rooms aren't big, they're fairly nice, with decent amenities. They'll also make reservations for you to go to Galleria Borghese and get the tix for you, which is GREAT. Unfortunately, the bad news is you're right down from teh US Embassy in a not necessarily night-life friendly area of Via Veneto, so you will have to take a train or a bus to get anywhere. Also, one of the lines that goes nearby (Barberini, I think) is closed till 09, so if you take the underground to go somewhere, make sure you know how to get back by bus if you go back after 9. My husband and I had a weird trip on a bus out to some bad 'burbs when getting lost on the way back from Termini one night. Anyway, Residenza A is nice. I'll probably stay somewhere else next time I go to Rome, just so I can see another area, but for business travelers, or people who want to spend a lot of time in the Villa Borghese, it's a great bet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SteveMedicoff
Reviews.Content: The Residenza "A" was the first hotel we stayed at in our 6 city trip. At first we were a bit reluctant to book such a small hotel, but was glad we did. The level of care and service was second to none. No huge attitude of some of the larger hotels, just warm and helpful. The hotel is right on Via Veneto, just a short walk to many of the best spots. We found ourselves walking every night to the Spanish Steps, and having a glass of wine at one of the many little places around the hotel. The room was perfect, Apple PC with Internet Service, very clean, and the Bulgari soaps and shampoos were top notch. The management in this hotel really care, and it shows it in everything they do. PS: After a long flight from Canada, it was great to have someone waiting for you at the Rome airport when you arrive. The hotel arranged it all. It cost 50 euros, but well worth the extra 10 euros a taxi would have cost. In addition the hotel arranged for a Vatican tour all in advance. Great hotel, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “A fine little boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: asucker
Reviews.Content: Well this was the second stop on our tour of Italy on our honeymoon and it was a very pleasant 3 nights. The hotel is small - very small - but makes up for the lack of size and facilities by the location and the great art on the walls. The staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast we took in our room and this was fine - huge pieces of toast (really huge). Would recommend if you are looking for small, discreet (but perfectly formed!!!). Thanks for making the stay pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but had some setbacks.”
Reviews.Author: cbandwb
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a great section of Rome. Roughly 3 long blocks to the metro system. We actually liked that the hotel does not obviously promote itself with signs outside...if you have the address, you'll get there. The front desk folks were exceedingly nice and would go out of their way to assist. We stayed in the XXL room which was nice with a small, but modern and clean bathroom. The idea of staying in a very small hotel appealed to us, however, the walls are thin and the maid makes a racket every morning outside your door which definitely interrupted our sleep time. There is a wonderful little breakfast place right around the corner which was wonderful at any time of the day or night. Stay away from the large fancy restaturants on the Via Venetio...very expensive and poor quality food compared to what you will get if you just search around a bit for a quiet traditional Italian restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: Richard73
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in January. Nice rooms. Decent size for Rome. Stayed in XXL which is a triple. The rooms are named by size, XS to XXL. Looked into some of the other rooms and seemed ok in size despite the names. The hotel is a converted apartment. Reception is manned from 7am to 10pm. Very helpful. With seven rooms the guys are not to busy and are happy to help. Bathrooms swish and well cleaned. Very nice toiletries (Bulgari) that your wife might decide to keep instead! Excellent shower. Rooms smartly furnished and in good shape. Painted white and walls spotless so must be painted regularly. Noise not a problem as our room faced inwards and it was off season. I think that even in high season it would not be as noisy as where we stayed near the spanish steps the last time. Limited breakfast, served in room or at the cafe next door. Nice cafe, excellent service. Would recommend the cafe. Breakfast in the room was ok, but I need more than one coffee. Toast was only toasted on one side and seemed too much bother to ask to remedy. Had a nice dinner in the cafe. About the same cost as anywhere on Via Veneto and a nice short walk to the hotel. The limited service is not a problem. Via Veneto is stuffed with fancy hotels and bars which you can use if you want. Very american street (hamburgers on most menus). Not the best atmosphere or shopping but liked it for being close to but away from the hustle of the spanish steps. Taxi rank very close by the Westin and paid 7.50 to get to St Peters and the Colosseum and 4.50 to the spanish steps (10 min walk). (Taxis irritating, change is a problem, award themselves 20/30% tips if you are not careful - have change!). Got the hotel to arrange a car to the airpost. Cost 50 euro which is 10 more than the taxi flat fare. Worth it for the mercedes, friendly driver and convenience. Reasonable supermarket in subway to spanish steps metro for essentials. Overall enjoyed our stay a lot and were quite satisfied with the hotel and location. Would recommend and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Residenza”
Reviews.Author: barsaec
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in the XXL room, with our 6yr old. The room was decent size for European standards. The hotel is on the second floor of a building near the top of Via Veneto. The property is small but well run. The staff was very helpful and accommodating. The hotel is all Italian tiled, very nice, but it did seem to amplify the hall-way noise. I truly loved having an iMac in the room. Each room has an iMac with internet access and iTunes for music. The art work in the room was also fantastic. Linens, towels, etc. were of good quality and very nicely designed. Breakfast is served at the restaurant Stregga next door. Breakfast was very good. There is a fixed menu with yogurt, fruit, juice, croissants, and a cappuccino. Note additional cappuccinos are 4euros. The hotel is well situated with close underground access to the Spanish Steps. We used the car service arranged through the hotel. For 50euro, you get an exciting trip to the airport. Our driver got us there in 20min.

Reviews.Title: “"A Perfect little gem"”
Reviews.Author: DKJNewYork
Reviews.Content: We just spent Christmas week in Rome with our three grown children. We found a perfect gem of a boutique hotel in which to rest our weary feet. The Residenza Boutique Art Hotel, perfectly located on the Via Veneto, offered modern decor with lovely bathrooms and free internet. There was something for everyone in our family in this small, second floor hotel. (Remember in Italy this is considered the first floor.) We had three of their seven rooms. M (by the reception area), S and XL. The letters indicate the room size. All were identical in decor. The service was tailored to the guest. We just had to let them know what kind of restaurant we were looking for, directions etc. and they were happy to help. Salvatore was especially kind to leave us printouts of things we had mentioned we wanted to see. He also mapped out which churches contained specific works of art by an artist we expressed an interest in. Speaking of art, the hotel is a gallery for local talent. The hallway and rooms have original works on display. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sb5000
Reviews.Content: I've always had trouble trying to find a good hotel in Rome. The Residenza A is a fantastic find. The service was fantastic, the room was great and the location wonderful. I definately reccomend it! It's a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Depends on the room”
Reviews.Author: Lawyer/Exporter
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a double. The rooms are not numbered but are called S,M,L etc. We were given Room M which is next to the reception desk and overlooking the lovely trees of the Via Veneto. We travel quite a lot with a small amount of luggage . Also we are not large people and we are used to small rooms in European hotels but this room and bathroom were TINY. We also could hear every word said in reception including the fax screaming at 7.00am. To the credit of the hotel, after several complaints, we were moved to XXL which was gorgeous. I cannot imagine what XS or S were like. It is such a usual thing that a hotel is only as good as the room you are given! One last tip. Complimentary breakfast is either at the cafe next door, which was ghastly , or in the room which was yummy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice find on Via Veneto”
Reviews.Author: Jayde88
Reviews.Content: Residenza A is very modern and the free internet and DVD player were great (although it didn't play one of our North American DVDs, saying the region wasn't right). Really liked the front desk staff, especially when we left. Carried our luggage down and all the way out on the street to the taxi because Via Veneto was undergoing construction and the car had to park in front of another hotel. Also liked breakfast at Cafe Strega. The food was ok but the atmosphere was very nice and you had a few options to choose from. Overall enjoyed the visit and would return here. We had the ML room and found it more than enough space. Really liked the rain-style showerhead in the bathrooms. Only note was - the car driver that took us from the hotel to the airport (arranged by residenza A) at one point he was doing 160 km/h and that was kind of scary.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch”
Reviews.Author: holslove
Reviews.Content: A top notch establishment that oozes quality. Trendy and modern, it is situated on the grand Via Veneto. First impressions were fantastic. We had to buzz to be let into a anonymous, huge wooden door on the street. It felt more like entering your own exclusive apartment building than a hotel (you were actually given your own front door key to let yourself in). Next was either a walk up the stairs to the first floor reception or take the fabulous see through metal gate lift, just like you see in the movies. Despite, a little mix up over a prior arranged transfer from the airport, there were no hitches and the staff couldn't do enough for you. The room itself was a good size by boutique standards, with an amazing double walk in shower. The nearest walking attraction was the Spanish Steps, about a 10 minute stroll. Would definitely stay again when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Sparkywilde
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a fabulous stay in Rome, but it was just too short. I found this lovely hotel on the internet and looked on Trip Advisor for some helpful hints and tips. We were not dissappointed. We booked through Venere.com but ended up emailing the hotel directly with our requests. Francesco was very helpful and looked forward to welcoming us as his favorite guests - trust me, you will not be dissappointed. I was expecting small rooms (trip advisor reviews) but we were pleasently surprised. We had room L at the back of the hotel (not a bad idea as they are actually digging up the road infront of the hotel but please don;t let it put you off!) and our friends had room XL which again was a lovely room. They could not do enough to help. You feel lke you are staying in their home and they are obviously very proud of it. Go to Harrys Bar across the road, very expensive but great for people watching. There's also a lovely cafe at the Westin, just down the road. Everything is within walking distance - Trevi - Spanish Steps - Pantheon - everything !!! We loved it, although not the cheapest place to stay, i would say, one of the best !!! Thank you for making it such a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “The Art of Roma”
Reviews.Author: Bolox
Reviews.Content: Only a stone's throw from the cool, green oasis of the Villa Borghese, surrounded by quality eateries inluding The Hard Rock Cafe for those hankering after US food and a 12 euro taxi ride from the station; this hotel is a friendly and convenient bolthole. The facade is simply a black door with 183 on it- an intercom is there should you arrive late- nestled between a ROLEX shop and the Caffe Stega. Staff are very welcoming and friendly; they cannot do enough to help make your stay an enjoyable experience. All speak English but appreciate pleasantries in Italian. On your arrival you are given three keys; bedroom door, apartment door and front door. It really must seem to those sat in the street 'people watching' that you have your very own apartment on this rather sulubrious street! For those seeking all the comforts of home with 'servants' yet without that over-bearing, intrusive or pretentious edge, this place is for you. Rooms and bathrooms are cool, comfortable, pristine and more than adequate in size for a couple travelling - inlcuding masses of wardrobe space. Bathrooms have large showers with glass doors and an interestingly placed full length mirror opposite, perhaps to ensure you reach the dirt on your back?! Whilst we did not consider the FREE internet access in our room as important for us in our bid to escape, we did actually find it invaluable on several counts to change our plans, check out the local information, maps etc, so it was a gift. Breakfasts were great and far too much to eat. Nearest metro is Barberini- 4 minute walk. The system is very cheap and simple to use. Watch out as the automatic tickets only give up to 4 euro change, and a 75 minute ticket costs 1 euro each with an all day ticket costing 4 euro. You can select which language the instructions are given in. The Vatican is 3 stops, the Spanish Steps walking distance rather than a train ride.

Reviews.Title: “Chic and Modern”
Reviews.Author: BeadyEyes
Reviews.Content: We booked a deluxe double and although price was steep at EUR265 per night, my husband and I welcomed the good bed, clean and nice sized room, sizeable bathroom with Bulgari amenities and sufficient wadrobe space and safe. It also had an aromatherapy thing which we planned but did not get to use. Of course, we found the Apple computer to be a great plus since we wanted to check on restaurants, places of interests and emails. Salvatore was also very friendly. The breakfast was another good point. Not that it was spectacularly good but it made a hearty meal and start of the day. Since this is so near the Galleria Borghese, you must visit it. It was the main highlight of our tour of Rome. Although the Colosseum, Roman Forum, Vatican are iconic, the Galleria Borghese was much more enjoyable. Have Salvatore prebook the tickets for you (when we got there, the museum was fully booked for the next 4 days) and make sure you go on the English guided tour, really a must to fully appreciate the treasures of the museum, esp. Bernini's masterpieces. Location wise, its near the spanish steps and the main shopping district yet quieter and you dont have loads of people walking by the street, which we liked. But be prepared to walk up a rather long hill to the hotel everyday or otherwise take a bus if you have bought the one day travel pass (BIG), which we did. In the genre of boutique hotels, this one does not pretend to be thematic or quaint or charming, it just is a good, modern, chic, very comfortable hotel with your own personal computer. And sometimes, thats really all we want. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: GalAdler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Residenza for 4 nights during Feb 2006. This tiny hotel is new, modern, elegant and comfortable. The rooms, although small, are smart and well equipped (iMac, TV and DVD, Bulgari toiletries). The location, near the top of Via Veneto, although about 10-15 min of walking down to the historic center, is notably upmarket (there are several Top-End hotels in this neighbourhood). The staff was friendly and helpful. Overall, we loved it, loved Rome, and looking forward to coming back. Gal and Ruby

Reviews.Title: “Hotel lived up to its web site”
Reviews.Author: HotelSeeburg
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel's web site when I saw it and my wife and I loved the hotel even more when we arrived. You never know what you find in hotels in big cities. Prices are often too high and the quality too low, but the Residenza "A" was not a problem at all. We found the facilities to be of high standard and the staff to be both friendly and helpful. And with the location being really convenient, we had a great weekend in Rome. We'll check out this hotel again next time we're in Italy. No hesitations.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel with friendly staff- chintz free!”
Reviews.Author: LondonBlonde
Reviews.Content: I took my boyfriend to Rome for a surpise pre-Christmas trip and chose the Residenza A based on the Time Out guide recommendation. I was looking for a non-chintzy and non-chain hotel at a reasonable price - and this met the mark perfectly. The hotel is central enough to be able to walk to most places or catch the metro and is on a rather lovely street with lots of expensive shops and big hotels nearby. The rooms were a little on the small side - but no worse than New York - and we neatly and stylishly decorated. The bathroom had a mosaic shower which was big enough for two to share and there was a nice selection of Bulgari toiletries and fluffy towels. Everything was very clean and modern. We had a modest but pleasant continental breakfast served to our room. The concierge was friendly and helpful - ordered taxis, recommended bus routes and arranged airport transfers cheerfully. Good English was spoken by all staff - which was essential for me as I speak no Italian.

Reviews.Title: “clean, modern and convenient”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we choose this hotel based on previous reviews found on trip advisor. Location wise I found it good, whilst it is not in the heart of rome it is in a nice location 10 mins from the spanish steps and the posh shops. On the first floor of the building you enter a small room, this is reception and then there is a corridor leading of it with the first room door visible to all that enter the reception area. We were put into this room and I would advise anyone staying there to avoid the room, I know you are not normally in the room for long but when you are its difficult to relax when there is someone right out side your door making phone calls (which means they can hear you if you get my meaning !). It is the location, as soon as you open the door you look straight at the bed and the line of sight and noise from the reception area is quite unsettling, this is not helped by the size of the room its fine for one person, but feels too small for two and the road is noisy so go for one facing the inside of the building. It is not a hotel, it is a residence, so it is much more like staying in a flat in Rome, which helps you too feel like more of a local than a hotel does, but without all the services and facilities you would normally have. The standard of cleaning in our room every day was excellent. One of the main reasons for staying was the opportunity to use the Apple Mac in our room for internet access and music, but it was not working. The breakfast in bed was okay, usual continental stuff. The American bar breakfast downstairs was much the same, not an American style one though. There is a small list of dvd's to hire if you are chilling out (EUR 4 each). You are entitled to use the health spa down the road, for free IF you buy the privledge card which costs eur 400. The staff were polite and helpful with good suggestions of restaurants. We found a restaurant called Gusto (modern italian and pizzeria) which is off via del corso, which is also good for shopping. Loved Rome but not the Residenza A, very tidy and very nicely furnished but for the money it wasn't big enough (I don't agree with those people that say rooms are small in Rome, thats rubbish, Paris has small rooms but the were still bigger than this one for the money !!!)and the facilities just aren't there, style over substance I'm afraid.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We found the Boutique Art Hotel online and did our research thru Trip Advisor and other review sites. Everyone had great things to say about it - and they were all right. It was quiet, a tad bit away from the center of things, but close enough to walk anywhere, the staff was super helpful and friendly, the room was clean and modern - we had internet access in our room - which was such an added bonus. We stayed 3 nights and would absolutely stay again - we had the "L" room, towards the back of the hotel. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Beware this hotel”
Reviews.Author: RTST1
Reviews.Content: After reading the good reviews of Residenza "A" on this site we booked, in July, for 3 nights in November 2005. On arriving, we were told that there was no room for us because a sick person could not be moved out of our room and no others were available. We would be transferred to another hotel. Why us we asked? We were assured we were the only new customers for that day - at which point another couple arrived - they were about to be told the same thing it transpired! Quite clearly, the hotel was overbooking - accepting customers via agencies, taking the best deals and palming off the less profitable to cheaper hotels. We had paid £370 sterling for the 3 nights. The hotel to which we were eventually transferred cost 120 euros per night. Clearly Residenza "A" would claim the £370 sterling, pay the hotel to which we were transferred 360 euros and pocket the difference! Nice one. Clearly the management cannot be trusted.

HotelInfo.Name: Residenza A
HotelInfo.Address: Via Vittorio Veneto 183, 00187 Rome, Italy
